question: Which country retained as the world's top most greenfield FDI investment destination?
explanation: India retained its numero uno position being the world's top most greenfield FDI investment destination for the second consecutive year, attracting USD 62.3 billion in 2016. India has remained ahead of China and the US as far as FDI inflows were concerned in the last year, said the fDi Report 2017 compiled by fDi Intelligence, a division of The Financial Times Ltd. FDI by capital investment saw an increase of 2 per cent to USD 62.3 billion in 809 projects during 2016 in India.
